snippet: Exit polls showed the governing party of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe on course to win as many as 306 seats, enough to keep its majority.
abstract: Governing party of Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe wins landslide victory in parliamentary election, despite low voter turnout; early elections were characterized as a referendum on Abe's economic-revival policies, but it remains unclear what Abe will choose to do with mandate.

byline.contributor: Hisako Ueno contributed reporting from Chofu, Japan.

lead_paragraph: Exit polls showed the governing party of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe on course to win as many as 306 seats, enough to keep its majority.

headline.main: In Japan, a Landslide Victory for Shinzo Abe’s Party, Despite Scant Enthusiasm
headline.print_headline: In Japan, a Landslide Victory for Abe’s Party, Despite Scant Enthusiasm
